# With God for Emperor and Empire

| runtime        = 55 minutes
| country        = Austro-Hungarian Empire
| language       = Silent  German intertitles
| budget         =
| gross          =
}}
With God for Emperor and Empire (German: Mit Gott f√ºr Kaiser und Reich) is a 1916 German silent war drama film directed by Jacob Fleck and Luise Fleck and starring Hermann Benke and Liane Haid. The celebrated operetta composer Karl Michael Ziehrer wrote a score to accompany the film at screenings.
It was one of a number of patriotic propaganda films made to support Austria's war effort during the First World War.
Cast
* Hermann Benke as Major von Hess
* Josephine Josephi as his mother
* Liane Haid as his daughter Liane
* Hans Rhoden as Leutnant Falk
References
Bibliography
* Robert Von Dassanowsky. Austrian Cinema: A History. McFarland, 2005.
